romanian.description: You are judged more by what you do than what you say. Your actions are proof to the things you say.

The pearl lies at the bottom of the sea, while the corpse floats on the surface.
The rich man’s wealth swallows the morsel of the poor.
The stairs are swept downwards, not upwards.
The sun rises whether the cock crows or not.
The sun warms the good man and bad man equally.
The village is burning and the granny is combing her hair.
The voice of the ass is not heard in heaven.
The wet man fears no rain.
The will is everything.
The wind gathers the clouds and the wind chases them away.
The wolf changes his fur, but never his habits.
The word of slander rings like a bell.
The worst wheel of a cart is the one that makes most noise.
The wound of a knife is easily healed, but the wound in the heart never.
There is no bitterer fruit than foreigners in one’s land.
There is no such thing as a good husband or a sweet onion.
There is no wedding without laughter and no death without tears.
There is no wine without dregs.
There is some respite from a barking dog, but never from wagging tongues.
There’s no smoke without fire.
Thieves increase with the making of new laws.
Thieves nowadays are not in the forests, but in the offices.
Thistle doesn’t catch in smooth cloth.
Three things are not to be lent: the horse, the gun. and the wife.
Throw the good to your left and right, and you’ll find it when you’ll need it.
Time ripens all things.
Truth lies at the bottom of the well.
Under a glove the ugliest hand is hidden.
Until the baby cries, the mother doesn’t give him suck.
Use your ears to listen, use your eyes to see, but use your mouth to shut up.
Water flows, but rocks remain.
Wealth is like a pool: as soon as you dig a channel, it all runs out.
What can’t be cured must be endured.
What is born of a cat will catch mice.
What is everybody’s business is nobody’s business.
When it dries up, one knows the worth of the fountain.
When misfortune sleeps, beware of awakening it.
When nuns dance the devil does not weep.
When one pot hits another, both break.
When the cat is not at home the mice dance on the table.
When the devil grew old he became a monk.
When the master is away the mice play on the table.
When you do good, you get good.
Where the liquor is in, the wit is out.
Where there are too many midwives, the baby is left with the umbilical cord uncut.
Where there is love, there is also a quarrel.
Where there is much learning, there is much folly too.
Where there is no head, woe to the feet.
Who flatters you has either cheated you or hopes to do so.
Who talks, sells; who listens, buys.
With money one can even buy rabbit cheese.
Woe to the house where the hen crows and the cock keeps silent.
Wolf doesn’t eat wolf.
Work has bitter roots, but sweet fruits.
Work is a golden bracelet.
Worse than the thief himself is the keeper of the thief.
You can’t straighten the world with your shoulder.
You do not know what is good until you lose it.
You need not look after the hoofs of dead horses.
Where defeat is inevitable, it is expedient to yield.
The thief who isn’t caught is an honest salesman.
Where the heart is willing it will find a thousand ways, but where it is unwilling it will find a thousand excuses.
There’s no physician like a true friend.
So long as you don’t step on a snail’s tail, he won’t get up and bite you.
Don’t try to sell pumpkins to a gardener.
If you lie upon roses when you’re young, you’ll lie upon thorns when you’re old.
If you are already wet, you won’t care about the rain.
You don’t go into a tavern to say your prayers.
Out of a devil’s egg there can only come a devil.
If you are travelling in the blind man’s country close one eye.
The man of many trades bakes his bread on Sunday.
A bad workman blames with his tools.
He, who is afraid of death, loses his life.
The rich man makes mistakes and the poor men get the blame.
A bad workman quarrels with his tools.
romanian.description: Blaming tools for bad workmanship is an excuse for lack of skill.

romanian.text: From fools, children and drunkards you get to hear the truth.
Your wife’s eyes are in your purse.
The truth is told in jokes.
A woman’s tongue is a double edged knife.
By proscription you give the face.
He who rises early goes far.
Don’t throw your blanket in the fire just because it has one flea in it.
Use a little fish to catch a big.
Examples evil communications corrupt good manners.
The eyes which don’t see each other, forget each other.
Wait there roan, to graze green grass.
Take money from the dry well.
You should not add oil to the fire.
The Need forces you to do.
The way to hell is tiled with good meanings.
The fruit does not fall far from the tree.
In a hundred years we will be dead anyway.
Don’t leave for tomorrow what you can do today.
Good goods, cheap goods.
Each to his taste.
He, who is afraid of death, loses his life.
Who digs a pit will himself fall therein.
Who chases two rabbits will get neither.
The wind does not paint red eggs.
The calm water is down reaching.
Such mother, such daughter.
Who is silent leaves no regret.
There is no smoke without fire.
We choose the lesser of two evils.
He gives double who gives quickly.
Such father, such son.
Don’t sell the skin of the bear from the forest.
The lion won’t turn on a barking puppy.
